intro: Petalostemon purpureus var. mollis, commonly known as the soft purple petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, showy purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms. The species is part of the family Acanthaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants.
